organizations.name: iSchool Academics
organizations.description: The *academics enterprise* encompasses every aspect of teaching, learning, and student experience in the school, with the broad goal of equitable, inclusive, and justice-centered information education.

concerns.name: Administration
concerns.description: These tasks are organization wide meta-tasks.

concerns.name: Courses
concerns.description: These are tasks related to course offerings, including schedules and classrooms.

concerns.name: Teaching
concerns.description: These are tasks related to teaching assignments and support

concerns.name: Curriculum
concerns.description: These are tasks related to the overall structure of our academic programs.

concerns.name: Community
concerns.description: These are tasks related to building community amongst our faculty, staff, and students.

concerns.name: Policies and Partnerships
concerns.description: These tasks concern iSchool, UW, and broader policy change, and our collaborations with partners and vendors.

concerns.name: Admissions
concerns.description: These tasks are related to inviting and selecting students into our learning communities.

concerns.name: Advising
concerns.description: These tasks are related to supporting students in their learning and lives.

concerns.name: Careers
concerns.description: These tasks are related to students career identity, planning, and goals.

concerns.name: Events
concerns.description: These tasks are related to event coordination and planning.

concerns.name: Professional Onboarding and Learning
concerns.description: These tasks are related to organizing professional learning for our staff and faculty.

processes.title: Track academics success
processes.what: ADA is accountable for monitoring each team's success; Assistant Dean and Data analyst track success in consultation with program managers and directors, identifying needs for change.

processes.title: Manage change and capacity for change
processes.what: ADA is accountable for school-wide changes in policies, procedures, and budgets; Assistant Dean and Academics PM are responsible for tracking and updating change, in consultation with all relevant parties.

processes.title: Eliciting proposals and demands for change
processes.what: ADA is accountable for soliciting feedback from stakeholders, including through IDEAS, program advocacy, and direct interactions with students (e.g., lunches with the Associate Dean, Dean, town halls, etc.)

processes.title: Prepare internal and external academic reports
processes.what: ADA is accountable for the reports (e.g., Taulbee survey, UW requests), the PM for creating them in consultation with Assistant Dean

processes.title: Student and guest employee HR conflicts
processes.what: Asisstant Dean is accountable for overseeing employee relations for academic student employees, ensuring the appropriate course of action is taken regarding employment related disciplinary issues, grievances or complaints (may include engaging with UWHR, Labor Relations or other UW offices).

processes.title: Manage academics fiscal budget
processes.what: AD is accountable for the budget, Assistant Dean is responsible for managing and monitoring it, including academic support, guest faculty, teaching assistants, teaching materials, supplies, honoraria for guest speakers, and academic events.

processes.title: Manage team budgets
processes.what: Directors of each team are accountable and responsible for managing their team budgets, in consultation with their team. For programs, chair is accountable and PM is responsible.

processes.title: Fundraising to support academics through grant writing and fiscal requests to UW and the state
processes.what: Assistant Dean is accountable for fundraising for student support, in consultation with ADA, program chairs, admissions, IDEAS, and advancement, e.g., writing grant proposals for student support.

processes.title: Plan initial course offerings each academic year
processes.what: Program chairs are accountable for offerings, but data analyst and program manager build initial proposal, in consultation with advisors and coordinators.

processes.title: Plan initial schedule and classroom assignments
processes.what: Program chairs are accountable for schedule quality; analyst drafts in consultation with program managers, director of teaching, and in compliance with university policy.

processes.title: Change classroom and schedule
processes.what: Program chairs are accountable for schedule quality, but program managers implement changes in consultation with team.

processes.title: Change enrollment cap and classroom
processes.what: Program managers are accountable for class sizes, in consultation with program chair. Data analyst implements.

processes.title: Design courses
processes.what: Instructors are accountable and responsible for instructional design in consultation with program chair and teaching and learning team. Teaching and learning team is responsible for ensuring minimum quality and alignment with course inventories.

processes.title: Help students register
processes.what: Program managers are ultimately accountable for student registration difficulties, as they shaped schedules; advisors and coordinators are repsonsible for helping students overcome them, in consulation with the program chairs.

processes.title: Withdraw a course
processes.what: Program chairs are accountable for course withdrawls and communicating them, consultation with PM, chairs, advisors, and coordinators. PM's implement.

processes.title: Manage and provision course offering data
processes.what: Data analyst is accountable for ADAM course offering data management solution, with help from IT, and in consultation with all users (ADA, chairs, PMs)

processes.title: Manage and support learning management systems
processes.what: Director of teaching is accountable for Canvas support, team is responsible. Instructors are consulted on needs.

processes.title: Create quarterly course instances on Canvas
processes.what: Learning manager is accountable for preparing course copies, templates, and other LMS work faculty cannot do independently.

processes.title: Course archiving
processes.what: Director of Teaching is accountable for archiving courses in a way that is compliant with UW requirements and shareable with future instructors, including metadata on who prepared the course.

processes.title: Design, development, and maintenance of Canvas templates and syllabus inclusions
processes.what: Learning Manager is accountable, specialists help, program chairs and instructors are consulted.

processes.title: Solicit and report student experience evaluations
processes.what: Director of Teaching and Learning manages student teaching evaluations, ensuring reviews for promotion requirements, and tracking about teaching quality, and reporting it to instructors and other parties. Analyst is responsible for tracking.

processes.title: Grading policy compliance
processes.what: Associate Dean is accountable for grades being submitted on time and correctly; Director is responsible for ensuring instructors do it.

processes.title: Initially assign instructors to courses (CAP)
processes.what: ADA is accountable for all teaching assignments, but delegates to program chair, program managers, and data analyst to construct each year's offerings for approval.

processes.title: Reassign course instructor
processes.what: When course assignments must change, ADA is accountable, Assistant Dean is responsible, and consults with program chairs, program managers, and relevant faculty to decide.

processes.title: Manage course load data
processes.what: ADA is accountable for teaching load, Assistant Dean responsible, identifying faculty teaching load assignments each year; monitor allocation and use of load releases for start-up, retention, sabbatical leave, family leave, or other accommodations across multiple years.

processes.title: Manage course release
processes.what: ADA accountable for course release, but Assistant Dean is responsible for process and reports, in consultation with PMs and guest coordinator.

processes.title: Assign PhD TAs
processes.what: PhD program chair is accountable for assignments because their role is to ensure that our PhD students are thriving. They do this work in consultation with the director of programs and the Informatics program chair.

processes.title: Reassign PhD TAs
processes.what: When TA assignments need to change, PhD chair is still accountable for assignments, but director of program services is responsible, to coordinate HR constraints.

processes.title: Prospect guest faculty
processes.what: Program chairs are accountable for cultivating new guest faculty prospects, in collaboration with the guest faculty coordinator. They can leverage their network, faculty networks, and advancement and admissions prospects.

processes.title: Hire guest faculty
processes.what: Programs chairs are accountable for identifying and recruiting warm prospects, in collaboration with the guest faculty coordinator, and in consultation with the program managers.

processes.title: Hire undergraduate TAs and reader/graders
processes.what: Director oversees TA hiring, Senior HR Assistants are responsible, in consultation with instructors.

processes.title: Onboard core faculty as instructors
processes.what: ADA is accountable for ensuring new faculty feel confident in teaching; they rely on program chairs and the teaching team to help them become confident.

processes.title: Onboard guest faculty
processes.what: Program chairs that have hired guests are accountable for guests having everything they need, but delegate to the teaching team and faculty.

processes.title: Administer learning technologies
processes.what: Director is accountable to robust and reliable administration of technologies; delegates to manager to achieve this.

processes.title: Support and train instructors on learning technologies
processes.what: Manager responds to tickets or delegates to specialists, and manages support resources.

processes.title: Maintain non-academic Canvas sites
processes.what: Specialists are accountable for program handbooks and resources, TA and reader/grader trainings, orientations instances, but not content, in consultation with program teams.

processes.title: Audit courses for equitable pedagogy
processes.what: Director is accountable for auditing equity in courses, including accessibility and other common inequities in course designs. Instructors and Associate Dean are informed.

processes.title: Contribute to campus-level teaching communties of practice
processes.what: Director ensures someone participates in campus level working groups on accessibility, teaching, campus level infrastructure etc.

processes.title: Evaluate learning technology innovations
processes.what: Director and manager examines new products and pedagogy for possible inclusion into teaching practices, in consultation with teachers.

processes.title: Resolve academic conflict and misconduct
processes.what: The ADA is accountable for resolving conflicts, but delegates this to program chairs to resolve at the program level when possible. This includes academic misconduct

processes.title: Intervene on low teaching quality
processes.what: The ADA is accountable for faculty instructional quality, and repsonsible for increasing it.

processes.title: Conduct peer teaching evaluations
processes.what: ADA is accountable for peer teaching, but director is responsible for process, ensuring compliance with faculty code and quality of reviews, and data tracking about teaching quality, in incorporating outcomes with broader data management.

processes.title: Ensure textbooks are ordered
processes.what: Teaching and Learning team is responsible for ensuring that faculty order text books they require, but faculty are accountable for ordering them and ensuring they are suitable.

processes.title: Create new programs
processes.what: Associate Dean is accountable for new programs and multi-unit collaborations, in consultation with Director. Program chairs are responsible when new initiatives are part of an existing program, or they are leading a new program.

processes.title: Set program strategic vision
processes.what: Program chairs are responsible for setting the vision, program managers are responsible for realiziing it, in consultation with the advisory board, program committee, academics council, and faculty.

processes.title: Propose curriculum changes
processes.what: To change the curriculum, chairs are accountable for negotiating changes with the help of the program chair; faculty, council, program commitee, and PM are consulted.

processes.title: Approve curriculum changes
processes.what: To get curriculum proposals approved through UW processes, Academic Services is accountable, in consultation with program managers and chairs.

processes.title: Implement curriculum changes
processes.what: After a change is approved, it must be implemented. Program managers are accountable, in consultation with the chair, advisors, and coordinators, and students and faculty are informed, and the advisory board and directors when relevant.

processes.title: Obtain accreditation
processes.what: Program chairs are accountable, and program managers lead, with consultation from nearly everyone in the school.

processes.title: Plan and coordinate student welcomes and orientations
processes.what: Programs chairs are accountable to welcoming new students to programs, and program teams are responsible for implementing, in consultation with ADA and Assistant Dean.

processes.title: Connect guest faculty in iSchool community
processes.what: The ADA is accountable for keeping guest faculty connected to the broader faculty, but the guest coordinator is responsible for implementing in consultation with program chairs and PMs.

processes.title: Facilitate student organization activities
processes.what: Advisors are accountable for liaising with student organizations (e.g., IUGA, WiNFO, etc.) in matters of mutual interest and to enhance communication, in consultation with program chairs, program managers, program comittees, and and the advisory board.

processes.title: Distribute student travel funding
processes.what: Students need opportunities to build networks with each other and the broader world, and we invest in that with travel support. Chairs are accountable for distribution, implemented by the program managers to support program community goals.

processes.title: Change program policy
processes.what: Program chairs are accountable for all policy changes, set in consulation with all stakeholders. PMs implement and solicit feedback.

processes.title: Respond to UW curriculum policy and procedure changes (SCAP, GCP)
processes.what: The Director of Academic Services is accountable to monitoring for changes in curriculum policies and procedures, and communicating them to program teams, ensuring compliance.

processes.title: Respond to UW registration policy and procedure changes.
processes.what: The Assistant Dean is accountable for monitoring changes in registration policies and procedures and communicating them to program teams to ensure compliance. Program chairs and PMs are responsible to responding to them. Everyone is informed.

processes.title: Lead partnerships with other academic programs
processes.what: The ADA is accountable for all academic partnerships, optionally delegated to program chairs, and in consultation with all stakeholders.

processes.title: Coordinate partnerships with external vendors
processes.what: The ADA is accountable for all external vendor partnerships, optionally delegated to relevant program chairs, and in consultation with all stakeholders.

processes.title: Monitor program health
processes.what: Program chairs are accountable for monotoring, PM implements in consultation with team and Director of Teaching and Learning. Leadership is informed.

processes.title: Manage program budget and expenditures
processes.what: Program chairs are accountable for program budgets, but PMs are responsible, in consultation with stakeholders.

processes.title: Advancement events
processes.what: Advancement is accountable for events, in consultation with program teams.

processes.title: Set school-wide admissions targets
processes.what: The size and projected growth of our academic programs drives planning initiatives. The ADA is ultimately accountable for deciding the direction and pace of growth, projecting future targets, and requesting adequate resources to sustain our degree programs at the desired scale. Assistant Dean is responsible for preparing planning documents, gathering statistics, creating a timeline, and developing justifications for any change in a program size in consultation with the respective Chairs and Program Managers. All plans must be approved by the Associate Dean, who will then seek approval from the Dean to allocate additional resources. All Academics staff need to be informed regarding the projected size of our programs and any planned growth. Everyoneâ€™s work is affected by these decisions.

processes.title: Set program admissions targets
processes.what: Program Chair is accountable for targets for the size of academic programs. The ADA gathers statistics for reporting. PMs and Assistant Dean are consulted to share their on factors to consider.

processes.title: Generate prospects through outreach and marketing
processes.what: Director is accountable for outreach, in collaboration with iSchool leadership, Communications team, external partners, and colleagues at peer schools to develop marketing strategies designed to promote the Information Science field and elevate overall awareness of the iSchool brand. Includes email compaints, event strategy, information sessions, conference attendance, funnel attribution.

processes.title: Devise admissions timelines
processes.what: To ensure admissions workload is manageable, the director is accountable for timelines in consultation with Chairs and Managers. Schedule should also align with the timing of the Scholarship workflow so that admissions offers and scholarship awards can be sent at the same time. The Admissions team, Program committees, and Executive Director need to be informed of this schedule when the decision is finalized.

processes.title: Devise admissions rubric and materials
processes.what:
Chair decides and evolves admissions rubric and materials submitted in consultation with IDEAS, team, admissions, as each program requires clear criteria for identifying qualified applicants. 
The Associate Director is responsible for making sure this decision is finalized by the Chair following consultation with the Program committee. The Associate Director may suggest or highlight options for how to determine these criteria, and advise on whether certain criteria are feasible to apply and compliant with UW policy or state law. After the Program committee has been consulted and the Associate Director has advised on feasibility and compliance, the Chair will make the final decision on approving the criteria. The program manager and admissions team needs to be informed.

processes.title: Create and maintain admissions applications
processes.what: Director is accountable for applications, implemented by admissions team in consultation with program leads, including creation, review process implementation.

processes.title: Identify and train reviewers
processes.what: The program chair is accountable for the quality of admissions, in collaboration with the program manager, committee, and advisors.

processes.title: Communicate to students about admissions , completeness, offers, acceptances, and waitlists
processes.what: Specialist manages communication on web, email, and other platforms about admissions timelines, decisions. Director is accountable.

processes.title: Application data management
processes.what: The admissions coordinator is resopnsible for processing applications, extracting review data, entering decisions, generating letters, funding package creation, processing minum requirements. Director is accountable, and team is consulted.

processes.title: Admissions information sessions
processes.what: Director is accountable for sessions, but admissions team and advisors are responsible for implementing, in consultation with the program chair and manager.

processes.title: Distribute scholarships
processes.what: The Assistant Dean is accountable for for distributing scholarships in line with IDEAS goals. Program managers for each team are responsible for decisions, in consultation with program chairs, admissions, and advancement.

processes.title: Re-recruit students to programs
processes.what: The Director is accountable for developing strategy in consultation with programs; includes PhD visit days, admitted student email compaigns, panels, etc.

processes.title: Advise students
processes.what: Advisors are accountable for guiding students on major options, requirements, transfer, admissions, career choices, financial resources, and university policies and procedure, in consultation with their program teams.

processes.title: Liase with UW groups that serve students (e.g., Undergraduate Academic Affairs, Registrar, Financial Aid, and UW IT)
processes.what: Lead advisor liaises with UW units that support academic advising efforts.

processes.title: Manage student online resources
processes.what: Advisors are accountable for online resources for students, in collaboration with coordinator, and in consulation with the program team.

processes.title: Program graduation progress tracking
processes.what: Program chairs are accountable for degree progress, in collaboration with program managers, and in consultation with the team. ADA and Assistant Dean are informed.

processes.title: Enforce continuation policy
processes.what: Lead advisor oversees of student records for the departmentâ€™s satisfactory progress (continuation) policy and prepare documents for probationary action by Associate Dean for Academics when necessary.

processes.title: Responding to student inquiries
processes.what: Advisors are accountable for quality replies to student inquiries, but coordinators are responsible for replying.

processes.title: Respond to front desk visitor needs
processes.what: Lead advisor are accountable to front desk needs, but mostly staffed by coordinators and peer advisors. Receive and route in-person requests from students, faculty, and other stakeholders.

processes.title: Peer advisor supervision and management
processes.what: Advisors are accountable to onboarding, supervise, and managing peer advisors.

processes.title: Process student leave petitions
processes.what: Advisors manage, but program chairs are accountable to policy compliance.

processes.title: Administer student IT
processes.what: Lead advisors manage, administrator, and set best practices for student IT (e.g., request tracker, bookings, sharepoint)

processes.title: Evaluate doctoral student progress
processes.what: Program chair is accountable for doctoral student progress, with support from advisor, in consultation with faculty and doctoral students.

processes.title: Coordinate student academic progress and degree completion
processes.what: Advisors are accountable to ensure completed degree audits and records, with the help of coordinators.

processes.title: Advise students on careers
processes.what: Career advisor is responsible for providing support current iSchool students in all degree programs, responding to and answering questions (in person, by email, or  phone) throughout the career planning process, providing career coaching and advising to students individually and in groups about career decisions and job search strategies, and review student employment materials (e.g. resume, cover letter, and LinkedIn profile). Director is accountable for quality, in consultation with director and program chairs.

processes.title: Maintain relationships with local, state, and national employers
processes.what: EEM is accountable for identifying and cultivating relationships with companies, organizations, and industries that have not previously interacted with iSchool Career Services, adivsing and counseling employers on the most effective way to identify and recruit iSchool students to meet the employerâ€™s needs, including campus recruitment, job postings, career fair attendance, and participation in panels, networking events, and workshop presentations. Share best practices with employers for establishing a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion and working with international students in recruitment activities. Update and expand employer contact database.

processes.title: Offer programming for career learning
processes.what: EEM is responsible for ensuring programming is aligned with career services learning outcomes and program curriculum, with the help of the coordinator. Director is accountable.

processes.title: Liaise with UW career services policies and resources
processes.what: Director serve as liaison with UW Career Center and other UW departments and offices in developing programs and providing career resources for iSchool students.

processes.title: Internship and fieldwork support
processes.what: Director is accountable for student internship support, but career advisor and program advisors are responsible for the support.

processes.title: Employer and student engagement
processes.what:
EEM is responsible for developing and leading programs for employer and alumni engagement with students including industry panels,
networking nights, resume review days, and mock interview event, in collaboration with IDEAS and Advancement.

processes.title: Plan and coordinate career fair
processes.what: EEM is responsible for the annual career fair's implementation and success, with the help of the coordinator. Director is accountable.

processes.title: Plan and coordinate iMentorship
processes.what: Advisor and coordinator are responsible for mentorship program, director is accountable, in consultation with programs.

processes.title: Support student leadership
processes.what: ADA is accountable for student leadership support, but director of careers is responsible leadership development activities for iSchool students including programming for student leaders and student organizations (such as Student Leadership orientation, council).

processes.title: Support career development
processes.what: Advisor is accountable and responsible, reviewing employement materials to inform its design, and consulting program chairs.

processes.title: Plan and coordinate academic events
processes.what: All coordinators and learning specialists represent a virtual team for event coordination and consultation, and can help reserve food, time, and space for any events related to programs, admissions, careers, and other academics activities. They also consult on best practices for tools, accessibility, and event streaming. The Assistant Dean is responsible for ensuring events happen.

processes.title: Plan and coordinate capstone
processes.what: The teaching and learning team are responsible for organizing the annual capstone event in response to instructor and program needs. The ADA is ultimately accountable for the event.

processes.title: Plan and coordinate iSchool graduation
processes.what: Assistant Dean is accountable for the event, with program managers, advisors, program coordinators responsible for making it happen.

processes.title: Plan and coordinate program-specific graduations
processes.what: If programs have dedicated graduations, their program managers are accountable for the event.

processes.title: Onboard Associate Dean
processes.what: The previous ADA is accountable for onboarding; the the Assistant Dean and PM are responsible for onboarding.

processes.title: Onboard Assistant Dean
processes.what: The Assistant Dean is onboarded by the ADA and PM.

processes.title: Onboard Program Chair
processes.what: The Associate Dean onboards program chairs, in with current and previous program chairs.

processes.title: Onboard Program Manager
processes.what: Program chair onboards program managers, with other program managers.

processes.title: Onboard Director
processes.what: All directors are onboarded by the Assistant Dean, in consultation with previous Directors.

processes.title: Onboard Advisor
processes.what: Program managers onboard advisors, with other advisors.

processes.title: Onboard Coordinator
processes.what: Coordinators are onboarded by program managers, advisors, and other coordinators.

processes.title: Onboard Senior HR Assistant and Guest Coordinator
processes.what: Director onboards HR assistants and guest coordinators, with other HR assistants and guest coordinators.

processes.title: Onboard Learning Manager and Specialist
processes.what: Director onboards manager and specialists, with other specialists.

processes.title: Onboard Data Analyst
processes.what: Director onboards data analyst, with other analysts, IT.

processes.title: Onboard Employer Engagement and Career Coordinator
processes.what: Director onboards employer engagement and coordinator.

processes.title: Facilitate director community
processes.what: The Assistant Dean is accountable for ensuring a vibrant community of practice to facilitate professional learning and career development. All directors are responsible for deciding on needs and events and actually making them happen.

processes.title: Faciliate program Manager community
processes.what: The Assistant Dean is accountable for ensuring a vibrant community of practice to facilitate professional learning and career development. All directors are responsible for deciding on needs and events and actually making them happen.

processes.title: Facilitate advisor community
processes.what: The Assistant Dean is accountable for ensuring a vibrant community of practice to facilitate professional learning and career development. All directors are responsible for deciding on needs and events and actually making them happen.

processes.title: Facilitate coordinator community
processes.what: The Assistant Dean is accountable for ensuring a vibrant community of practice to facilitate professional learning and career development. All directors are responsible for deciding on needs and events and actually making them happen.

processes.title: Facilitate Teaching & Learning community
processes.what: The Associate Dean is accountable for ensuring a vibrant community of practice to facilitate professional learning and career development. Director for teaching and learning is responsible for deciding on needs and events and actually making them happen, in consultation with all teachers.

processes.title: Facilitate Program Chair community
processes.what: The Associate Dean is accountable for ensuring a vibrant community of practice to facilitate professional learning and career development. All directors are responsible for deciding on needs and events and actually making them happen.

roles.title: Instructors
roles.description: All faculty, PhD students, and guest faculty serving as instructors.

roles.title: Students
roles.description: All students in relevant iSchool academic programs.

roles.title: PhD students
roles.description: All iSchool doctoral students.

roles.title: Dean
roles.description: The Dean of the Information School

roles.title: Associate Dean for IDEAS
roles.description: The iSchool's leader of inclusion, diversity, equity, accessibility, and sovereignty

roles.title: Associate Dean for Faculty
roles.description: The iSchool's leader for faculty affairs

roles.title: Associate Dean for Academics
roles.description: The iSchool's faculty and student-facing leader for all things academics.

roles.title: Academics PM
roles.description: The ADA's project manager, who trackes and manages change in academics.

roles.title: Executive Director for Academics
roles.description: The staff-facing leader for all of academics, in charge of operations, staff supervision, and budgets.

roles.title: Academics Council
roles.description: All faculty and staff in academic leadership roles

roles.title: Program Chair
roles.description: Faculty members leading one of our academic programs

roles.title: Program Manager
roles.description: Staff leadership managing change in programs

roles.title: Advisory board
roles.description: External partners who guide our academic programs

roles.title: Program Committee
roles.description: Faculty and staff who support operations of our academic programs

roles.title: Lead advisor
roles.description: Staff who lead student learning and progress

roles.title: Advisor
roles.description: Staff who support student learning and progress

roles.title: Coordinator
roles.description: Staff who support program operations

roles.title: Director Academic Services
roles.description: Staff leader who facilitates human resources and curricular change

roles.title: HR Assistant
roles.description: Staff who help us recruit and hire guests and student teachers

roles.title: Guest Coordinator
roles.description: Staff who help us recruit guest faculty

roles.title: Director of Teaching
roles.description: Staff leader who ensures high quality teaching and learning in the school

roles.title: Learning Manager
roles.description: Staff who help us manage our learning technologies

roles.title: Learning Specialist
roles.description: Staff who ensure quality teaching

roles.title: Data Analyst
roles.description: Staff who manage data around teaching and learning

roles.title: Director of Admissions
roles.description: Staff leader who oversees all admissions and outreach processes in academics

roles.title: Admissions Advisor
roles.description: Staff who support student prospecting and recruiting

roles.title: Admissions Operations Specialist
roles.description: Staff who help implement our admissions processes and policies

roles.title: Admissions Coordinator
roles.description: Staff who support our admissions operations

roles.title: Director of Careers
roles.description: Staff leader who helps students with career learning and opportunities

roles.title: Career Services Advisor
roles.description: Staff who support students in finding and securing career opportunities and developing career identity

roles.title: Employer Engagement Manager
roles.description: Staff who manages our relationships with employers

roles.title: Career Services Coordinator
roles.description: Staff who help with career services operations

roles.title: Director of Communications
roles.description: Staff leader who oversees all iSchool communication

roles.title: Director of Advancement
roles.description: Staff who oversees all fundraising and alumni relations

roles.title: Advancement Officer
roles.description: Staff who oversees advancement activities and operations

roles.title: iAffiliates
roles.description: A community of strategic business partners with curated engagement plans

roles.title: Business Improvement
roles.description: Staff who support process effiiciency in the iSchool

roles.title: Finance
roles.description: Staff who support financial management in the iSchool

roles.title: Registrar
roles.description: University of Washington registrar

roles.title: Continuum College
roles.description: The collge that engages learners in the broader community and oversees our fee-based programs

roles.title: HCI+D Program
roles.description: Our interdisciplinary human-computer-interaction program shared with other units on campus

roles.title: Data Science Program
roles.description: Our interdisciplinary data science program shared with other units on campus
